props.title: Fed Square - Seagull TV
props.content:
How to bring an iconic “place” brand to life, while increasing visitor dwell time and enjoyment in a public space? Seagull TV at Fed Square was the creative answer to this challenge; an ever evolving interactive experience, activating the impressive Big Screen as a part of the Fed Square #Kaleidosquare summer program.

The seagull has become the “tongue in cheek” mascot of Fed Square and features heavily in all their comms. Seagull TV has brought it to a new level, as a fun and creative place-making experience that tells the story of Fed Square and Melbourne through the eyes of the cheeky seagulls!

Seagull TV invites visitors into the world of Gull-O-vision, featuring; an immersive interactive experience that turns visitors into seagulls, gesture driven AR games and the hottest new music from the avian "Buoy Band" sensation GULL5 and more.

In Live Reflections, players are transformed into seagulls on screen, and can wander around the game space to unlock hidden actions, like eating food, spinning decks at the DJ booth, diving off a dive-board or even peeing in the pool!

'Seagull Sessions' experience brings the best of the best of seagull music to the masses, such as the avian buoy band sensation GULL5’s hit song 'Relationchip', which has been written as a love song to Melbourne.

The entire activation is played in real time; experiences presented with accurate day and night cycle, live weather effects and procedurally created content based on actual events in the square, resulting in a "living" experience that is never the same or boring however many times you see it.

See the activation in action in Fed Square

props.title: See the activation in action in Fed Sqaure
World Square - Cherry Blossoms Festival
props.content:
World Square’s annual Cherry Blossom Festival brings Japan’s cherry blossom phenomenon to Sydney, in a jam packed 3 week event.

We helped bring the Cherry Blossom Festival to life via a series of digital placemaking activities that combined the physical and virtual together in magical ways, to create impactful and immersive experiences.

The centerpiece of the festivities was the custom built Torii Gate, that not only created 1000s of ‘grammable moments, but also acted as a portal to another dimension via AR, virtually converting the whole square into a dreamy cherry blossom experience in real time.

This AR experience seamlessly transitioned into an “offer hunt” that ushered our shoppers from one retailer to another to find virtual origami boxes full of goodies. A dynamic “petal path” guided them to the next offer box and encouraged them to seek and unlock more offers, promoting footfall and dwell time.

Finally, we have activated the giant screen via three Japanese inspired gamified experiences, using our unique platform combining augmented reality, skeletal and gesture tracking, depth mapping and artificial intelligence-driven live characters.

These experiences were wildly popular, hosting up to a hundred engaged users at the busiest sessions, leading to an average of 7,500 active and passive engagements per day.

props.title: Spatial Sauce Case Study: World Square's Cherry Blossom Festival

title: ANZ Tower Liberty Place - The Giving Tree

props.title: ANZ Tower Liberty Place - The Giving Tree
props.content:
The Giving Tree is a project very close to our hearts. We have collaborated with JLL and The Smith Family for this compelling installation at Liberty Place / ANZ Tower, one that really brings the spirit of Christmas to life.

Combining innovative technology with very engaging content, we have transformed the traditional foyer Xmas tree installation into a fun donation kiosk, one that engages passers-by and encourages them to donate to Toy & Book Appeal for Australian kids in need.

The interplay within the kiosk and the tree, and the loveable antics of our cheeky Elf “Libby” rewarded our donors very memorable moments, putting smiles in the hearts and minds of the donors and spectators alike.

Doing great work for a great cause is double the fun and satisfaction, and this project definitely had it all.

props.title: 200 Women: The Listening Ground
props.content:
This interactive exhibition was as inspiring as the amazing backdrop it was set in, at the concourse of the one and only Sydney Opera House.

Supported by Westpac, the exhibition is an extension of a storytelling project and book of the same name. It is founded on 200 interviews with women in different parts of the world and different circumstances, who are asked five fundamental questions on the theme; 'what is most important to them'.

The exhibition featured the stories of these 200 women from around the world in photos and video content presented via custom-built listening pods. Stories covering leadership, overcoming challenges and pain, happiness, and change. Stories from everyday women you wouldn’t recognise, and stories from the iconic and influential. Extraordinary women such as Rosie Batty, Collette Dinnigan, Miranda Tapsell, and Margaret Atwood.

Working closely with partner agencies, we have created these sculpturesque interactive pods that tell the stories of 200 remarkable women, using innovative technologies such as motion detection and spatial sound, driven by custom and unique UX design for the circular screens for creating a seamless experience, and a digital “guest book” for social advocacy that was installed in the central “beacon” structure.

*Our team has developed this project for Westpac’s agency Maverick.

props.title: World Square - Oxapalooza
props.content:
We have created Oxapalooza Lunar New Year Festival 2021 for World Square, to celebrate the Year of the Ox in style. Oxapalooza Festival is a 30 day celebration of food, shopping, entertainment, art and culture, featuring the Mighty Ox preceding over the activities as a larger than life statue installation at the square, and as a virtual character across all touchpoints.

We have provided an end-to-end service; from event concept, naming and brand development to on-site digital, web and social campaign creative and production, 3D modelling and animation, two interactive activations and more - working closely with World Square team and other collaborators.

On-site OOH media, web, EDM and social campaigns consisted of five custom variations of the creative for each of the pillars of the activity; eat, shop, play and win, running across 60 touchpoints in all channels.

Studio Oxaplaooza mobile webapp encouraged visitors to take selfies with the Mighty Ox and share on their socials, whereas Lucky 8 mobile AR campaign generated footfall across the whole precinct, by sending users on a hunt to find and unlock the red envelopes to find lucky coins and win amazing prizes.

Combined with LNY themed cultural and art activities such as lion dances, curated food journeys, art exhibitions and more, Oxapalooza packed a hefty punch!

props.title: Oxapalooza LNY 2021 Festival for World Square
Piaggio - Zip out with Vespa
props.content:
“Zip out with Vespa” is a lighthearted, quick and fun Instagram AR filter for the iconic Vespa brand, with a vision to offer a short and fun virtual escape for the Vespa fans around the world locked in their homes during the pandemic. As they were not able to get on the road, we brought the road to them!

It encourages fans to “zip out” for a ride for a quick beverage on their virtual Vespa, randomly taking them to one of the five most desired destinations around the world. Users can enjoy the perfect cup of espresso in Milan, a delicious bubble tea in Singapore, a hot brewed green tea in Tokyo, a rich chocolate milkshake in Paris and a colorful mocktail in Sydney!

Using augmented reality, we have seamlessly embedded the users’ face onto the virtual Vespa rider in the filter in real time, allowing them to “drive” their Vespa by the head and face gestures, and “drink” the beverages for a fun effect.

The filter encourages users to record their trip as a video and share as an Instagram story, achieving social advocacy and spread for the brand, and has been picked up by numerous industry influencers around the world.

title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres  -  Meet the Natives

props.title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres  -  Meet the Natives
props.content:
Santa’s Secret Garden is an unique Christmas Santa Set built for Macquarie Centre; with a design based on Australian native fauna and flora, made of thousands of live Australian native plants.

We wanted to also feature native Australian animals as a part of the experience, but it’s not as easy to have live animals on set as it is to have live plants of course. So, we have used the power of AR in the form of a custom Instagram / Facebook filter, one that the visitors can activate on location and seek, find and experience Australian native animals within the set virtually.

The UI of the app works like a “sonar” which encourages the user to “scan” the area and follow the “blips” until they hone in on the location of the animal and reveal it in AR. Each animal has different behaviour, animations and custom soundscape, making the experience fun and exciting for the little ones.

Meet the Natives is a lighthearted, quick and fun Instagram AR filter that augments the existing physical set, and gives the visitors another reason to explore it and spend more time on location. The filter also encourages users to record their animal encounters and share as an Instagram story, achieving social advocacy and spread for the Centre.

props.title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres - Meet the Natives
World Square - Ratrobats
props.content:
To celebrate the Year of the Rat, World Square developed an artistic program that took Lunar New Year celebrations to grand heights, including the high-flying Ratrobats.

Inspired by the ancient tradition of Chinese acrobats and performers, a troupe of eight larger-than-life ‘Rats’ that show off their acrobatic skills were developed as custom built sculptures. The friendly Rats are dressed in brightly coloured costumes, each in a different energetic pose.

But, when the cheeky Ratrobats came to life in Augmented Reality on the interactive giant screen, the fun really began! Shoppers were transformed into Ratrobats on the screen in real time; as they saw themselves on the screen, a beam of light hit them and transformed them into one of the Ratrobats, just like magic!

They were then challenged to compete in a number of physical games such as juggling, spinning hoops and balancing wind spinners, as the timer runs down for a nail biting finish.

The installation was exciting, amusing, engaging and interactive, and created a lot of buzz for World Square.

props.title: JLL - Virtually Wild
props.content:
Virtually Wild is an "edutainment" experience like no other, developed as a school break activity to entice family audiences back to M Group shopping centres around the country.

The activation virtually puts the kids in the same space with the most beloved wild animals, such as elephants, lions and gorillas using a custom built big screen installation.

Using AR with AI, we created a unique immersive space with "live" animals that interact with our guests, freely roaming the space, reacting to the visitors’ actions and even eating from their hands!

Unlike other AR installations with pre-rendered linear 3D content, our experience is 100% LIVE and our AI driven animals roam the area freely interacting with guests, engaging with them naturally walking in front and behind them in 3D space with no need for green screen setups.

Each animal had a unique habitat that was created by augmented digital content onto the physical set, and a custom soundscape. We have created the character Sir Edward G. Hamilton as the insightful and inspiring naturalist and narrator, helping us balance exciting and fun interactions with respectful and educational encounters, ensuring we educate and inspire our young guests as we entertain them.

The activation had to tour multiple Centres nationally, so had to be portable and flexible enough to set up in different spaces and formats. It's a great proof that experiences of this calibre are not exclusive to big museums, and can be brought to local centre setups as well.

title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres - The Little BIG Roadtrip

props.title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres - The Little BIG Roadtrip
props.content:
We have developed “The Little BIG Roadtrip” AR Campaign for the portfolio of AMP Capital Shopping Centres in Australia and New Zealand targeting family audiences, encouraging them to make multiple visits to the Centres during the Easter school break.

School breaks used to mean family holidays and road trips. But not lately, as we are all pretty much stranded. So, we decided to take our visitors on a road trip around Australia as a short, fun and irreverent getaway; without leaving the Centres.

The Little BIG Roadtrip AR campaign takes shoppers on a virtual road trip collecting tokens and winning Prizes, one "big thing" at a time! From BIG Banana to BIG Galah, from BIG Prawn to BIG Pineapple, these beloved novelty slices of Australiana are as much fun in AR as they are IRL, and appeal to parents and kids alike.

Users were encouraged to seek and find all eight BIG landmarks in the Centre by solving the riddles about the location of the next, and each landmark gave them more tokens for a draw to win prizes.

props.title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres - The Little BIG Roadtrip
Various - Santa’s Magical Mailbox
props.content:
Writing letters to Santa is an Xmas classic, and an activity kids and parents enjoy together. Many shopping centres install physical “Santa Letter Mailboxes” to capitalise on this existing user behaviour, to create goodwill within the community as well as footfall into the property. However, this age-old activity lacks an “instant reward” mechanism that today’s audiences crave.

Santa’s Magical Mailbox is created to change that, and to add a fun and “magical” instant reward mechanic to the process; one that attracts and engages family audiences. Combined with the in-built Santa Photos mechanic, it’s the perfect Christmas installation for any size Centre!

At the heart of it is a custom built “post office” with an embedded screen and a custom mailbox equipped with a special scanner. As the kids drop their letter into the mailbox, it’s scanned and digitized in real time.

Then the very letter they just dropped in appears as a part of the virtual content that starts playing within the screen. They can magically see it go through its journey from the mailbox to Santa’s Mailroom, or even all the way to Santa’s hands via the cheeky Elf! This gives the child an instant gratification, as well as a magical “sneak peek” into the inner workings of Santa’s Magical Kingdom, making the whole process of sending a letter feel so very real.

The kiosk also doubles as a virtual Santa Photo Booth, allowing visitors to take photos with Santa in a fun and lighthearted way. Once this mode is activated, Santa appears on the big screen as an augmented reality video live character, and encourages the users to take four photos with him. It’s designed to work just for one person or the whole family, in a very versatile approach.

Santa shows them fun poses to do, and once they strike the pose, a photo is taken automatically. At the end of the sequence, the users can download the four shots they have with Santa to their mobiles using the provided on screen QR code and share to their socials directly. This no-touch and fun way of doing Santa photos is a great alternative for Santa sets, especially in the Covid era.

title: ANZ Tower Liberty Place - Melbourne Cup Event

props.title: ANZ Tower Liberty Place - Melbourne Cup Event
props.content:
We helped Liberty Place to take their annual Melbourne Cup Event for the Precinct to the next level, by integrating a number of innovative tools and activations to streamline and enhance the activities.

The key activation was the “Super Sweeps” which was developed as an innovative and automated new way to do the age-old “Melbourne Cup Office Sweeps” for the entire precinct, allowing hundreds of tenants to play in the same sweeps.

We have built a custom kiosk that automates the sweep entry process end to end; including payment collection via integrated “tap to pay” technology. It randomly assigns a horse to each player at the sweep value they’d like to play in, and once all horses in that value are taken, it automatically creates another round, so that new players can join in as well.

The sweeps system also automatically selected the winners based on the race results, and transacted their winnings to their accounts directly.

We have also built an integrated invite, RSVP and door check-in system, that automated the entire process and helped manage the guests in an efficient manner, and also installed a photo booth with custom creative content developed exclusively for Liberty Place.

title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres  - A Message from Santa

props.title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres  - A Message from Santa
props.content:
“A Message from Santa” is a digital building brand campaign targeting the holiday period, developed for the AMP Capital Shopping Centres portfolio running across 18 centres in Australia and New Zealand.

Offered as a complimentary service for the shoppers and the local communities, the activity aims to provide a way to allow the kids to “meet Santa” -albeit virtually - at a time many Santa visits at the Centres are cancelled.

The custom designed website allows parents to securely enter information about their children, which results in a personalised video message from Santa being sent to them, bringing Christmas joy to kids of all ages and their families.

In the video, Santa greets them by their name, and knows details about them such as their age, grade and siblings, which makes it a very believable and magical experience for the young ones. They also get to find out that they have been Nice this year, and they will be getting the gift they asked for.

Campaign has yielded great results as well, with over 16,000 visitors creating over 6,000 unique videos which ended up being watched over 24,000 times. Merry Christmas indeed!

props.title: AMP Capital Shopping Centres - A Message From Santa
JLL - World of AI
props.content:
JLL wanted to present innovative and exciting content at their annual company conference, to excite and inspire their teams and create talkability.

We have created a number of activations using the power of artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision, to showcase the possibilities these technologies can offer for their business; via fun, lighthearted and irreverent creative wrappers that offered a short break from the more serious proceedings of the day.

“AI Lens” installation showcased how computer vision can be used to monitor and analyse video feeds, with examples ranging from serious utility (i.e. tracking and analyzing crowds in a busy shopping centre in real time) to the humorous and silly (i.e. comparing Bolshoi ballet dancers to a troupe of 4 year olds!) We have applied live real time AI training models on pre-existing footage due to the logistical reasons on the day.

“Highfive-o-meter” activation was designed as an icebreaker and a fun team building experience, where the AI rates the quality of the high fives the team members give each other and ranks them against each other, with an irreverent slap-stick execution.

“Live room” activation was a live camera set in the ballroom, which monitored the team while they were having post conference drinks and provided live reporting on items such as number of people, sentiment in the room, most popular outfit colors etc.

Utilising some of the most advanced technologies of our times for fun and entertaining experiences via pitch perfect creative ideation is what we live for; so, this was a project we loved to work on, and had lots of fun doing so.
